pros: I worked at Paramount Senior Living in Lancaster for a few months at the end of 2022 and it was an incredible experience. The facilities are beautiful and well-maintained, and the management team is wonderful. They provide opportunities for learning and growth through certificates that they help you get. One of the best things about working here is the flexibility of the hours. The management team was always willing to work with me to ensure that I can balance my work and personal life (and as a mother of 2 toddlers, that was very helpful). The option to choose the hours that work best for me is a rare find in the senior living industry, and I appreciate it tremendously. Overall, I highly recommend Paramount Senior Living in Lancaster as a welcoming and growth-oriented workplace.
cons: Only negative was the distance from my house to the building, we moved away and I couldn't work there anymore...

pros: The staff was good and friendly.
cons: Entry level job, not much room for growth.

pros: Residents are great. Love interacting with them
cons: Corporate is awful. Snakes in the grass

pros: Hired me with no experience

pros: Free lunches, meeting new people

review_title: stay away from paramount senior living
pros: Taking care of residents like they are family
cons: Management gives rewards to staff who don't have proper credentials, fake diplomas and cpr certificates purchased online. And staff who abuse residents rights are also given special treatment.

job_title: Dietary Aide in Seven Fields, PA
pros: Working with the residents was always the highlight of my day
cons: Management is extremely abusive. They’ll lie about sick days you didn’t take, etc. Document everything.

pros: Flexible work hours great for school
cons: I don’t quite know yet

job_title: Lead RCA in Middleburg Heights, OH
pros: Great Company with good pay!

review_title: Do not give them your time or business!
job_title: Resident Aide in Seven Fields, PA
pros: You don't need qualifications to work here.
cons:
You don't need qualifications to work here: I was excited to find a job in a healthcare setting that didn't require me to have my CNA. The reason this is a "con" is because I was asked to do things I wasn't confident or comfortable doing. Managements never around to help regardless of what they tell you. 
Management has SERIOUS issues: everyone is family. 
You are not valued: you are not appreciated. You are not valued. I have heard from the management before that "if you're not happy, leave. Everyone is replaceable". That's a nice way to treat your employees! 
Drama between EVERYONE
Your activities department is not part of your nursing staff and they should not be expected nor allowed to "work" as an "aide" and be a "body on the floor" covering a shift. Absolutely not.

pros: The free meals are good tuition reimbursement is great too
cons: Need to reevaluate health insurance is to expensive

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Mars, PA
pros: Working w geriatrics. Esthetically pleasing facility.
cons: Pay is poor. Don and administration treat employees extremely bad. They don’t care about employees or residents. Your looked down upon like a lowly employee. They play favorites. One nurse gets all the OT. Never offered to others.  Everyone is unhappy. Turnover is ridiculous. You will never feel good after work about your job. They try to force OT if you call out on a weekend shift, you’re expected to work next weekend. Even if you schedule your weekend off, you are scheduled the following weekend like a punishment.  30 years of nursing and this place is in top 5 worst of worst. I feel I have PTSD after working for them only 6 months.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Seven Fields, PA
pros: Decent ETO, good benefits, free meals, shift differential, fair pay and most floor nurses are generally good to work with.
cons: Management turns a blind eye to obvious reports of employee misconduct, to the point where its actually just unbelievable. I've never seen a place where some people get away with murder repeatedly and some get in trouble for little nitpicky things. If you're a favorite of theirs and work lots of overtime for them you can practically do whatever you want. Staff showed very little appreciation

pros: I really enjoyed getting to know the residents. While I was there, they really worked around my school schedule.
cons:
You're on your feet the entire time. 

The only reason I left this job was because of the other employees. I worked here through high school and I could NOT handle hearing the other employees talk about each other or their supervisors with such disrespect.

pros: Loved the residents. Most of the coworkers are great. Free lunches. Overtime is usually available because they're always short staffed.
cons: Management. A lot of nepotism in this specific location. Unless you're related you are going nowhere. Management spends too much time on the internet shopping. They appreciate no one until they give notice. It's not until then that they pretend to actually care. Probably because corporate sends you a packet in the mail to review your reasons for leaving. Turnover there is very high. They lose a lot of good employees and dedicated caregivers because they don't have the correct last name.

review_title: Sounds good on the web site
pros: Paramount recently took over Brookdale White Chapel. Too soon to tell if there will be the promised improvements.
cons:
The uniforms they issued were cheap and not appropriate to the jobs.All white for nurses, no pockets in scrub pants, white shirts and black vests for kitchen staff.
A bad sign, that they not not understand our jobs.

job_title: Line Cook/Prep Cook in Seven Fields, PA
pros: Pleasant coworkers, the daily tasks are fun, you are truly helping the people who live there.
cons: It can be a sad place to work due to it being a personal care facility. The pay was low.

pros: There are not many other than getting to work with the old people. They are nice sometimes and fun to talk to.
cons: The managers are very strict to the point that it is counterproductive. My co-workers were very annoying but I don't think that is really the company's fault.
